metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
To the Worthy Members of Saint Andrews Club

Most humbly that your petitioner is uncapable [incapable] of getting my living any manner of way by reason of old age and other Disorders  I am very bad with a Rupture and Rumettick [rheumatic] pains  I am Sometimes So tormented that I cannot rest night or Day    I am very naked and so bare of clothing that I have none to keep me warm or Clean    I have no manner of way to gett [get] Relief without making application to your honnours [honors]. I have slaved very hard for King and Country and by means of heats and great colds has brought all these disorders upon me   I have no place of residence only I am beholden to some friend or other that Succours [succors] me Sometimes   So I hope your honnours will consider my pitifull condition and allow one Some help  

May it therefore please your worthy gentlemen to take the premisses[premises] to consideration and your petitioner is ever bound to pray

While I am John McKenzie [signature of applicant]

Charlestown November
30th 1769
